description:
Ellis, a young girl suspected of murdering a prominent physicist Heinrich Schneider, is on the run from an underground society called "Hunters" when she is tracked down by the bounty hunter Nadie in a small Mexican town. However, instead of turning her in, Nadie impulsively decides to help her and the two girls embark on a journey to Ellis' hometown, where they plan on finding clues about her past. From there, they travel south to search for the mysterious Gemstone of the Inca Rose, the "Eternal City" of Wiñay Marka, and Ellis' own obscure destiny.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Fugitive
tags.description: Prominently features a character evading capture by an individual or organization.

tags.name: Yuri
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two females, not inherently sexual. Also known as Girls' Love.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Witch
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a witch.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Bisexual
tags.description: Features a character who is romantically or sexually attracted to people of more than one sex or gender.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

name.native: ジョディ・ヘイワード / ブルーアイズ

node.description:
__Cousin:__ [Aaron Dismuke](https://anilist.co/staff/95254/Aaron-Dismuke)

__Justin Ryan Cook__ is an American voice actor, producer, line producer, ADR director and enginner who works for FUNimation.
[Website](http://www.nanriyuuka.com/)
[Website](http://www.nanriyuuka.com/)

**Birthplace:** Los Angeles, California
**Spouse:** Rachel Robinson (2019-)

**Introduction:**
Christopher Bevins, alternatively known as Chris Bevins is an American voice actor, ADR director and script/screenwriter. He is more known for his work as an ADR director at FUNimation Productions in Dallas/Fort Worth, Texas.

**Non-anime roles:**
~!- Dhalsim and Soldier A (David) in "Street Fighter V" (VG)
- Dhalsim in "Street Fighter IV" (VG)
- Dhalsim in "Street Fighter X Tekken" (VG)
- Koga, Brycen and Swimmer in "Pokémon Masters" (VG)
- Legault in "Fire Emblem Heroes" (VG)
- Nadai in "Fist of the North Star: Lost Paradise" (VG)
- Shishiwakamaru in "Yu Yu Hakusho: Dark Tournament" (VG)
- Voice in "FUNimation" (logo bumper)
!~
**Non-anime staff credits:**
~!- Script Adaptation for "Sengoku Basara: Samurai Heroes" (VG)!~
Affiliated with [C-Station](https://anilist.co/studio/6074/CStation).
Affiliated with [C-Station](https://anilist.co/studio/6074/CStation).
Affiliated with [C-Station](https://anilist.co/studio/6074/CStation).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kawasak54965532)

Hiroyuki Kawasaki is a screenwriter and novelist.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Fion0806) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100001583365922) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0BLHMPWOZ2aTI0ZCCbtZem) | [Apple Music](https://music.apple.com/artist/yuki-kajiura/251013990) | [Deezer](https://www.deezer.com/artist/4663498)

Yuki Kajiura was born in Japan but raised in West Germany for most of her childhood. Her father was a big fan of classical and opera music and always desired for Yuki to play the piano for him. Yuki eventually gained a love for music and a love for the piano. Yuki started out as an SE programmer, but changed to music in 1992. She made her grand debut with a female trio called "[See-Saw](https://anilist.co/staff/104342)."  In the years to come the group released six singles and two albums. 

Yuki then went on to work on her solo career composing for artists and some TV, films, and games, such as _Blood: The Last Vampire_ in 2001, and _Xenosaga II_ and _III_. In 2001, Yuki's claim to fame came with the release of the anime [_NOIR_](https://anilist.co/anime/272). The soundtrack sold 50,000 copies. In 2002, she was brought on to project .hack to write the score to [_.hack//SIGN_](https://anilist.co/anime/48), along with vocalist [Chiaki Ishikawa](https://anilist.co/staff/101059) and New York singer [Emily Bindiger](https://anilist.co/staff/103845). Shortly after Yuki comprised an album of original and complied songs known as Fiction, working again with Emily Bindiger as well as _Xenosaga_ vocalist Deb Lyons.  

Yuki's other well-known works were for [_Mobile Suite Gundam Seed_](https://anilist.co/anime/93), which hit 5th on the Oricon Charts its first week, and selling over 200,000 copies. Yuki has also become known for her work on CLAMP's [_Tsubasa Chronicle_](https://anilist.co/anime/177) series, [movie](https://anilist.co/anime/807), and [OVAs](https://anilist.co/anime/2685). In 2003, she formed the project [FictionJunction](https://anilist.co/staff/103691) in which pairs Yuki's songwriting and composition with different performing vocalists, first as separate solo works and later into a singular group. In 2007, Yuki formed the band [Kalafina](https://anilist.co/staff/101975), with two partners from FictionJunction, Wakana Ootaki and [Keiko Kubota](https://anilist.co/staff/104664), to perform for the anime [_Kara no Kyoukai_](https://anilist.co/anime/2593), further working on several others. Kalafina disbanded in 2018, with their final lineup including Wakana, Keiko, and [Hikaru](https://anilist.co/staff/168857).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Fion0806) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100001583365922) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0BLHMPWOZ2aTI0ZCCbtZem) | [Apple Music](https://music.apple.com/artist/yuki-kajiura/251013990) | [Deezer](https://www.deezer.com/artist/4663498)

Kouichi Mashimo is a well-known Japanese anime director and the founder of the animation studio Bee Train. Since the creation of the studio, Mashimo directed or otherwise participated in (nearly) all its works, for example, as a member of art or sound department.

Mashimo was born in Tokyo, Japan and from his early years showed interest in photography, admittedly under the influence of his father. Mashimo studied jurisprudence at Sophia University and during his fourth university year, he participated in the making of several television commercials. However, this was a rather disappointing experience, and on November 6, 1975, he applied for a position of Hiroshi Sasagawa's assistant director in Tatsunoko Production. The first anime series he worked on was Time Bokan (1975–76).

In the mid-1980s, while still working for Tatsunoko, Mashimo survived a severe alpine skiing accident. During his stay in an intensive care unit, he came up with an idea of a "hospital for animators", an animation studio whose primary goal would be fostering and self-actualization of talented artists rather than commercial success and money. Some time after that, he founded a small freelance studio called Mashimo Jimusho that was mainly producing in-between animation for larger companies. In 1997, Mashimo presented his studio-as-hospital concept to Mitsuhisa Ishikawa, the president of Production I.G, who was so impressed with it that he immediately agreed to sponsor Mashimo. The new subsidiary has become known as Bee Train and in February 2006, it ended its relationship with I.G and became independent.

(Source: Wikipedia)

The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Policeman in "Chuck E. Cheese in the Galaxy 5000"
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/bang20140617)

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/cunepero)**

Kojima got started in the industry one day while he was working as a freelancer in various industries and somehow ended up with a job in anime at the age of 23.

His first project was on the show "[Shima Shima Tora no Shimajirou](https://anilist.co/anime/9768/Shima-Shima-Tora-no-Shimajirou/)" under [Studio Kikan](https://anilist.co/studio/256/Studio-Kikan), where he got started of by doing in-between animation. At the time he was very unexperienced with anime production and has [said](https://www.arabnews.jp/article/arts-culture/article_26145/) he likely would have been fired for his lack of knowledge and poor quality work, if not for the in-between animation checker teaching him everything from scratch.

Later down the line after establishing himself more in the anime industry, he would go on to work on "[Gurren Lagann](https://anilist.co/anime/2001/Tengen-Toppa-Gurren-Lagann/)" as a challenge to himself, where he would put forth mecha and effects animation he had no idea how to prior.

Kojima [states](https://www.arabnews.jp/article/arts-culture/article_26145/) he feels a lot of inspiration from manga artists who are able to think about a story, break it up into panels, and express it in pictures. He has thought about drawing a manga himself, even if it's something simple.

Some of his favorite anime are "[Inital D](https://anilist.co/anime/185/Initial-D/)," "[Natsume's Book of Friends](https://anilist.co/anime/4081/Natsume-Yuujinchou/)," "[Re:ZERO -Starting Life in Another World-](https://anilist.co/anime/21355/ReZero-kara-Hajimeru-Isekai-Seikatsu/)," "[Neon Genesis Evangelion](https://anilist.co/anime/30/Shin-Seiki-Evangelion/)," "[A KITE](https://anilist.co/anime/320/A-KITE/)," "[JIN-ROH](https://anilist.co/anime/570/JINROH/)," "[FLCL](https://anilist.co/anime/227/FLCL/)" and "[Doukyuusei -Classmates-](https://anilist.co/anime/21096/Doukyuusei/)."

Some of his favorite manga are "[HI Score Girl](https://anilist.co/manga/74501/Hi-Score-Girl/)" and "[A White Rose in Bloom](https://anilist.co/manga/108360/Mejirobana-no-Saku/)."

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/choco_kiku) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/菊地洋子)

Married to [Eiji Suganuma](https://anilist.co/staff/109167/).

_Note: Not to be confused with [Youko Kikuchi (菊地陽子)](https://anilist.co/staff/141535/), different kanji._

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/choco_kiku) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/菊地洋子)

Married to [Eiji Suganuma](https://anilist.co/staff/109167/).

_Note: Not to be confused with [Youko Kikuchi (菊地陽子)](https://anilist.co/staff/141535/), different kanji._

__Graduated:__ Toyo University

During school Sawai always aimed to be manga artist. After graduating from Toyo University he joined Tatsunoko Production where he became a storyboard artist and later episode director. He served two more years as a production assistant there until he left and became a freelance episode director. Today he works mainly for Bee Train, whose founder Kouichi Mashimo is a good friend of his.

name.native: フィクションジャンクション

node.description:
FictionJunction is a solo project by the composer [Yuki Kajiura](https://anilist.co/staff/100077), consisting of collaborations with several vocalists, all of which are female (aka utahime). Kajiura herself plays the keyboard or the piano.

From 2003 to 2009, the project was fragmented into duo groups with Kajiura and the soloists with the name "FictionJunction 〇〇" (ex. "FictionJunction KAORI") but in 2009 they all unified under the name "FictionJunction."

__Utahime:__
• KAORI - [Kaori Oda](https://anilist.co/staff/101399) (織田かおり) (also joined [Sound Horizon](https://anilist.co/staff/100754))
• KEIKO - [Keiko Kubota](https://anilist.co/staff/104664) (窪田啓子) (also member of [Kalafina](https://anilist.co/staff/101975))
• WAKANA - Wakana Ootaki (大滝若奈) (also member of [Kalafina](https://anilist.co/staff/101975))
• YURIKO KAIDA - [Yuriko Kaida](https://anilist.co/staff/103489) (貝田由里子) (also works solo as KAiiDA)
• YUUKA - [Yuuka Nanri](https://anilist.co/staff/95366) (南里侑香)
• ASUKA - [Asuka Kato](https://anilist.co/staff/103810) (加藤あすか) (also works solo as Aira Yuuki)

__Guest vocalists:__
• [Aimer](https://anilist.co/staff/107859) - (has participated in live performances since 2019)
• [LiSA](https://anilist.co/staff/105561) - (featured on the song "from the edge")
• Revo - (has participated in live performances)

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/dajinman)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/tomoyuki.kurokawa.7)__

__Tomoyuki Kurokawa__ is a Japanese director, episode director and storyboard artist. He was affiliated with studio Bee Train.

He made his lead directorial debut with the OVA _[Murder Princess](https://anilist.co/anime/1696/Murder-Princess/)_, and had his first lead director role with the release of _[Psychic Detective Yakumo](https://anilist.co/anime/7662/Shinrei-Tantei-Yakumo/)_.

name.native: サヴィッジ・ジーニアス

node.description: savage genius is a Japanese band signed to Victor Entertainment. The duo Aa (vocals and lyricist) and Takumi (composer/arranger, producer) started as a songwriting group in the live music scene in Kobe. They debuted in the 2001 AXIA Artist Audition, and signed with Warner Music Japan, cutting two singles.  On November 30, 2007, it was announced that one of the group's members, Takumi, had retired.  (Source: Wikipedia)

__Hometown:__ Brooklyn, New York City, New York, USA

Emily Bindiger is an American singer who is part of the a cappella group the Accidentals.

In the anime world she's known for her collaboration with composer and song writer [Yuki Kajiura](https://anilist.co/staff/100077). Bindiger and Kajiura first met during production of ".hack//SIGN" and Kajiura reportedly "fell in love with her voice." Bindiger performed over 10 of the series' insert songs. Kajiura jokingly called Bindiger "her English teacher" at Anime Expo 2003.

Kajiura and and Bindiger teamed up again for the album Fiction featuring songs from Kajiura's past works as well as three original songs. In 2007 Bindiger performed again for Yuki on [El Cazador de la Bruja](https://anilist.co/anime/2030) performing inserts "forest" and "I reach for the sun" and most recently the insert song in [Pandora Hearts](https://anilist.co/anime/5530) "Everytime you Kissed Me."

Besides working with Kajiura Bindiger has also worked with [Youko Kanno](https://anilist.co/staff/95508) in the [Cowboy Bebop](https://anilist.co/anime/1) OST "Adieu" and "Flying Teapot."
The brother of voice actress, [Brina Palencia](https://anilist.co/staff/95659/Brina-Palencia).
